conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have clear height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volumes read as rooms, and the view is angled/isometric with the ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness and corners; floor plane separation is clear. Cutaway is mostly clean with minor simplification at some openings/edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Core spaces (kitchen/utility/stair zone/dining-like open area) appear present with generally similar adjacencies, but proportions and several partitions/openings do not tightly match the 2D plan segment (e.g., breakfast/pantry/window-seat zone and some wall runs/openings look simplified or shifted).

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen counters/appliances and dining table are present; utility room is represented. Bathroom fixtures appear present. Some furniture/room program (e.g., bed) is not clearly supported by the provided 2D crop, suggesting potential program/layout mismatch.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is mostly readable with consistent materials, but interior door geometry is faint/ambiguous and a large text label on the floor reduces presentation clarity. Lighting is adequate but slightly flat, making some openings harder to verify.

detected_errors.description: Noticeable layout/proportion simplifications vs the 2D plan segment; several wall runs and the right-side zone (pantry/breakfast/window-seat area) do not align cleanly.
Door/window placements and opening widths are not fully verifiable and appear approximated relative to the 2D plan.
Text label ('UTILITY ROOM') present in the 3D render reduces presentation score per rubric.

summary: A genuine cutaway 3D conversion with strong volumetric rendering, but only moderate geometric fidelity to the 2D layout due to simplified/shifted partitions and openings.
